data.title: CTET (Social Studies) Official Paper-II (Held On: 07 Jul, 2024)

options.value: Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं और (A) की (R) सही व्याख्या करता है।&nbsp;
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं लेकिन (A) की (R) सही व्याख्या नहीं करता है।

en.value: A key commonality in Piaget and Vygotsky&#39;s theories is :

options.value: Involvement and engagement of children in their own learning.&nbsp;
The role of culture in the cognitive processes.
Their views of relationship between language and thought.&nbsp;
Focus on stage-like progression in children&#39;s development.&nbsp;

hn.value: पियाजे और वायगोत्स्की के सिद्धांतों में एक प्रमुख समानता __________ है।

options.value: बच्चों की स्वयं की शिक्षा में संलग्नता और जुड़ाव
संज्ञानात्मक प्रक्रियाओं में संस्कृति की भूमिका
भाषा और विचार के बीच संबंधों के बारे में उनके चिंतन
बच्चों के विकास में चरण - जैसी प्रगति पर ध्यान&nbsp;

en.value: According to Jean Piaget, how are children different from adults?

options.value: Children&#39;s thinking is qualitatively different from that of adults.
Children&#39;s thinking is quantitatively different from that of adults.
Children are dependent on adults while adults are independent.
Adults are much more knowledgeable than children.

hn.value: जीन पियाजे के अनुसार बच्चे वयस्कों से किस प्रकार भिन्न हैं?

options.value: बच्चों की सोच वयस्कों से गुणात्मक रूप से भिन्न होती है।&nbsp;
बच्चों की सोच मात्रात्मक रूप से वयस्कों से भिन्न होती है।&nbsp;
बच्चे वयस्कों पर निर्भर होते हैं जबकि वयस्क स्वतंत्र होते हैं।&nbsp;
बच्चों की तुलना में वयस्क बहुत अधिक ज्ञानी होते हैं।

en.value: You are a teacher who wants to help your students develop metacognitive skills. Which of the following strategies is most likely to foster this type of thinking?

options.value: Providing students with summarised notes for assignments.
Assigning homework that requires memorization and recall.
Giving students marks instead of qualitative feedback on their performance.
Encouraging students to reflect on their own learning and thinking processes.

hn.value: आप एक अध्यापक हैं जो अपने विद्यार्थियों को परासंज्ञानात्मक कौशल विकसित करने में सहायता करना चाहते हैं। निम्नलिखित में से कौन-सी रणनीति इस प्रकार के चिंतन को बढ़ावा देने की सबसे अधिक संभावना है?

options.value: विद्यार्थियों को सत्रीय कार्य के लिए सारांशित नोट्स प्रदान करना।
गृहकार्य साँपना जिसके लिए याद रखते और याद करने की आवश्यकता होती है।
विद्यार्थियों को उनके प्रदर्शन पर गुणात्मक प्रतिपुष्टि के बजाय अंक देना ।
विद्यार्थियों को अपने स्वयं की अधिगम और चिंतन प्रक्रिया पर विचार करने के लिए प्रोत्साहित करना।

en.value: According to Lev Vygotsky, what is the relationship between language and thought?

options.value: Language and thought are independent of each other
Language and thought are complex&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41);">interrelated processes of development</span>

hn.value: लेव वायगोत्स्की के अनुसार भाषा और विचार के बीच क्या संबंध है?

options.value: भाषा और विचार एक दूसरे से स्वतंत्र हैं।
भाषा और विचार विकास की जटिल विनिमेय प्रक्रियाएँ हैं।&nbsp;
भाषा विचार को आकार नहीं देती है।
विचार भाषा को आकार देते हैं।

en.value: A teacher asks herself - &quot;How can I provide experiences that require students to classify different types of objects in the environment and analyse their classification schemes?&quot; Which intelligence is she trying to promote in students?

hn.value: एक शिक्षिका स्वयं से पूछती है - &quot;मैं ऐसे अनुभव कैसे प्रदान कर सकती हूँ जिसमें विद्यार्थियों को पर्यावरण में विभिन्न प्रकार की वस्तुओं को वर्गीकृत करने और उनकी वर्गीकरण के स्कीमों का विश्लेषण करने की आवश्यकता हो ?&quot; वह विद्यार्थियों में किस बुद्धि को बढ़ावा देने की कोशिश कर रही है?&nbsp;

en.value: Feedback to the students in a classroom is most effective when :

options.value: It focuses on what the child cannot do rather than what they can do.
It centres around tests and exams at the end of the year.
It assigns comparative ranks to the students.
It occurs during as well as after the learning activity.

hn.value: विद्यार्थियों के लिए कक्षा में प्रतिपुष्टि सबसे अधिक प्रभावी होती है जब-

options.value: यह इस बात पर ध्यान केंद्रित करता है कि बच्चा क्या नहीं कर सकता बजाय इसके कि वह क्या कर सकता है।
<span style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41);">यह वर्ष के अंत में परीक्षण और परीक्षा पर केंद्रित है।</span>
यह विद्यार्थियों को तुलनात्मक श्रेणी प्रदान करता है।
यह अधिगम की गतिविधि के दौरान और पश्चात भी होता है।

bn.value: ক্লাসরুমে শিক্ষার্থীদের প্রতি প্রতিক্রিয়া সবচেয়ে কার্যকরী কখন হয়?

options.value: এটি শিশুটি কী করতে পারে না তার উপর ফোকাস করে, তারা কী করতে পারে তার উপর নয়।
এটি বছরের শেষে পরীক্ষা ও পরীক্ষার চারপাশে কেন্দ্রীভূত।
এটি শিক্ষার্থীদের তুলনামূলক স্থান নির্ধারণ করে।
এটি শেখার কার্যকলাপের সময় এবং পরে উভয় ক্ষেত্রেই ঘটে।

gu.value: શાળાના વર્ગખંડમાં વિદ્યાર્થીઓને પ્રતિસાદ સૌથી અસરકારક ક્યારે મળે છે?

options.value: તે બાળક શું કરી શકતું નથી તેના પર ધ્યાન કેન્દ્રિત કરે છે, તે શું કરી શકે છે તેના પર નહીં.
તે વર્ષના અંતે પરીક્ષાઓ અને પરીક્ષણોની આસપાસ કેન્દ્રિત છે.
તે વિદ્યાર્થીઓને તુલનાત્મક રેન્ક સોંપે છે.
તે શિક્ષણ પ્રવૃત્તિ દરમિયાન તેમજ પછી થાય છે.

en.value: Rama is a teacher who is implementing Vygotsky&#39;s theory in her classroom and she assigns her students to work in groups to complete a challenging task. During the task, one student struggles to understand a key concept. What would be the most effective way for Rama to help this student?

options.value: Assign a different task to the student that is better suited to her abilities.
Work through the problem with the student and providing guidance and feedback as needed while involving other group members.
Provide the student with the answer to the problem so the group can move on.
Encourage the student to try to solve the problem on her own.

hn.value: रमा एक शिक्षिका है जो वायगोत्स्की के सिद्धांत को अपनी कक्षा में लागू कर रही है और वह एक चुनौतीपूर्ण कार्य को पूरा करने के लिए अपने विद्यार्थियों को समूहों में काम करने के लिए नियुक्त करती है। कार्य के दौरान, एक विद्यार्थी एक महत्वपूर्ण संकल्पना को समझने के लिए संघर्ष करता है। रमा के लिए इस विद्यार्थी&nbsp;की सहायता करने का सबसे प्रभावी तरीका क्या होगा?

options.value: विद्यार्थी को एक अलग कार्य सौंपें जो उसकी योग्यताओं के अनुकूल हो।&nbsp;
विद्यार्थी के साथ समस्या पर काम करें और समूह के अन्य सदस्यों को शामिल करते हुए आवश्यकतानुसार मार्गदर्शन और प्रतिपुष्टि प्रदान करें।
विद्यार्थी को समस्या का उत्तर प्रदान करें ताकि समूह आगे बढ़ सके।
विद्यार्थी को समस्या को स्वयं हल करने का प्रयास करने के लिए प्रोत्साहित करें।

en.value: Change and stability in emotions, personality, and social relationships together constitute :

hn.value: भावनाओं, व्यक्तित्व और सामाजिक संबंधों में परिवर्तन और स्थिरता किस विकास में शामिल हैं?

en.value: Constructivist teaching leads to _______&nbsp;learning by students.

hn.value: रचनावादी शिक्षण विद्यार्थियों को ______&nbsp;अधिगम की ओर ले जाता है।

en.value: In progressive education, children are perceived as:

options.value: Vulnerable and in need of protection
Compliant and capable of only consuming knowledge

hn.value: प्रगतिशील शिक्षा में बच्चों को किस तरह देखा जाता है?

options.value: ज्ञानवर्धक और अर्थ की रचना करने वाले
कमजोर और सुरक्षा की जरूरत में
आज्ञाकारी और केवल ज्ञान का उपभोग करने में सक्षम

en.value: Jean Piaget&#39;s theory of cognitive development implicates that :

options.value: Curriculum should be designed keeping children&#39;s age group and stage in mind.
Focus of teaching should be the outcome of the activity instead of the process of thinking.
Behaviour should be conditioned using rewards and punishments.
Concepts should be taught in a sequence of complex to simple.

hn.value: जीन पियाजे के संज्ञानात्मक विकास का सिद्धांत यह बताता है कि

options.value: पाठ्यचर्या को बच्चों के आयु-समूह व चरण को ध्यान में रखकर तैयार किया जाना चाहिए।
शिक्षण का बल गतिविधि के परिणाम पर होना चाहिए न कि सोचने की प्रक्रिया पर ।
व्यवहार को दंड और पुरस्कारों के माध्यम से अनुकूलित किया जाना चाहिए।
अवधारणाओं को जटिल से सरल के क्रम में सिखाया जाना चाहिए।

en.value: How does setting mastery goals impact a student&#39;s motivation and views of ability?

options.value: It often implies enhanced extrinsic motivation and belief in the entity view of ability.
It often implies enhanced extrinsic motivation and belief in the incremental view of ability.
It often implies enhanced intrinsic motivation and belief in the entity view of ability.
It often implies enhanced intrinsic motivation and belief in the incremental view of ability.&nbsp;

hn.value: महारत हासिल करने के लक्ष्य निर्धारित करने से विद्यार्थी की अभिप्रेरणा और योग्यता के बारे में विचार कैसे प्रभावित होते हैं?

options.value: यह अक्सर योग्यता के स्थिर दृष्टिकोण में बढ़ी हुई बाहरी अभिप्रेरणा और विश्वास को दर्शाता है।
यह अक्सर योग्यता के वृद्धिशील दृष्टिकोण में बढ़ी हुई बाहरी अभिप्रेरणा और विश्वास को दर्शाता है।
यह अक्सर योग्यता के स्थिर दृष्टिकोण में बढ़ी हुई आंतरिक अभिप्रेरणा और विश्वास को दर्शाता है।
यह अक्सर योग्यता के वृद्धिशील दृष्टिकोण में बढ़ी हुई आंतरिक अभिप्रेरणा और विश्वास को दर्शाता है।
Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A)..
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं और (A) की (R) सही व्याख्या करता है।
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं लेकिन (A) की (R) सही&nbsp;व्याख्या नहीं करता है।
Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).&nbsp;
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं और (A) की (R) सही व्याख्या करता है।
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं लेकिन (A) की (R) सही व्याख्या नहीं करता है।

en.value: Which of the following hinders the participation of students with visual impairment in the classroom?

hn.value: निम्नलिखित में से क्या दृष्टिबाधित विद्यार्थियों को कक्षा में भागीदारी लेने में बाधा डालता है?

options.value: उभरी हुई रेखा चित्र और मानचित्र
इलेक्ट्रॉनिक रूप से प्रारूपित व्याख्यान प्रतिलेखन

en.value: Which of the following is a correctly matched pair?

options.value: Formative assessment: determining what the students can do before and after the class
Summative assessment: involves paper - pencil tests as well as detailed accounts of non- written behaviours
Criterion - referenced assessment: includes mastery of specific topics
Norm - references assessment: compares performance to that of peers

hn.value: निम्नलिखित में से कौन-सा सही सुमेलित युग्म है?

options.value: रचनात्मक आकलन : यह निर्धारित करना कि विद्यार्थी कक्षा से पहले और बाद में क्या कर सकते हैं।&nbsp;
योगात्मक आकलन : इनमें पेपर पेंसिल परीक्षण के साथ-साथ गैर-लिखित व्यवहारों के विस्तृत विवरण शामिल हैं।&nbsp;
मानदंड - संदर्भित आकलन : विशिष्ट विषयों की महारत शामिल है।&nbsp;
मानक-संदर्भित आकलन : साथियों के प्रदर्शन की तुलना करता है।&nbsp;

en.value: Sunita, a 12 year old girl, shows exceptional musical ability. Both her parents are accomplished singers, and they send her for classes for voice training after school. Her capabilities are most likely to be the result of an interaction between :

hn.value: सुनीता, एक 12 वर्षीय लड़की, विशेष संगीतीय क्षमता रखती है। उसके माता-पिता, दोनों ही निपुण गायक हैं और वे सुनीता को अपनी आवाज को और बेहतर करने के लिए प्रशिक्षण कक्षा में भेज रहे हैं। सुनीता की यह क्षमता संभावित रूप से किन कारकों के अंतःक्रिया का परिणाम है?

en.value: Which method did Lawrence Kohlberg used to study moral development of children?&nbsp;

options.value: Conducting observations of children during play
<span style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41);">​</span><span style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41);">Quantitative research approach</span>
Posing moral dilemmas to children and analyzing responses

hn.value: लॉरेंस कोहलबर्ग ने बच्चों के नैतिक विकास का अध्ययन करने के लिए किस विधि का प्रयोग किया?

options.value: खेल के दौरान बच्चों का अवलोकन करना
बच्चों के सामने नैतिक दुविधाएँ रखना और अनुक्रियाओं की समालोचना करना
Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A).
Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A).
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं और (R),<span style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41);">&nbsp;(A)</span>&nbsp;की सही व्याख्या करता है।
(A) और (R) दोनों सही हैं लेकिन (R), <span style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41);">(A) की&nbsp;</span>सही व्याख्या नहीं करता है।

en.value: Which of the following statement is correct about &#39;Autism&#39;?&nbsp;

options.value: Autism is caused solely by environmental factors.&nbsp;
Autism can be cured and improves with age.
All autistic people have at least one exceptional skill.

hn.value: निम्नलिखित में से कौन-सा कथन &#39;स्वलीनता&#39; के संदर्भ में सही है?

options.value: स्वलीनता केवल वातावरणीय कारकों के कारण होता है।
स्वलीनता का इलाज किया जा सकता है; उम्र के साथ इसमें सुधार आता है।
स्वलीनता वाले सभी लोगों में कम-से-कम एक विशेष कौशल होता है।&nbsp;
<span style="color: rgb(33, 37, 41);">स्वलीनता एक तंत्रिकीय विकासात्&zwj;मक विकार है।</span>

en.value: News on social media:
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow:

1. On 15 January 2009, several interesting things happened. A plane crash landed into the Hudson River, right in the middle of New York City. The pilot, crew and 155 passengers escaped safely. But then, something else happened... Jim was nearby and watched the event happen. He immediately tweeted that he had just seen a plane crash in the Hudson. From there the news spread quickly. People contacted him immediately and asked him what was happening, and other people on the street took photos and videos with their phones and posted them online. Ordinary people suddenly became journalists. It was 15 minutes before the news broke on official news channels.

2. Photos, videos and tweets from ordinary people at the scene of dramatic events now provide the words and images that describe events in the news. When a meteor exploded over a Russian city in 2013, millions of people around the world watched videos and photos of the event on Facebook and YouTube. Social media can also save lives. In January 2010, an earthquake hit the Caribbean island of Haiti. The government said that there had been an earthquake, but they didn't give many details at first. Meanwhile, people living in the disaster area were posting photos and eye witness accounts on Twitter and Facebook and telling the world that it was an emergency and houses were collapsing. A local radio presenter used this information to help people find family members, and people even phoned his program to ask if their relatives were safe.

3. News travels fast on social media, but false stories spread just as quickly as the truth. Some of these "facts" are erroneous, others are deliberate hoaxes. Hoaxes remind us that not everything people post and publish is reliable. But social media can change our lives for the better.

en.value: The wind in the poem talks to:
en.comp:
Read the poem given below and answer the questions that follow:

Great, wide, beautiful, wonderful world,

With the wonderful water round you curled.

And the wonderful grass upon your breast

World, you are beautifully drest.

The wonderful air is over me,

And the wonderful wind is shaking the tree,

It walks on the water, and whirls the mills,

And talks to itself on the tops of the hills.

You friendly Earth! How far do you go,

With the wheat-fields that nod and the rivers that flow.

With cities and gardens, and cliffs, and isles,

And people upon you for thousands of miles?

Ah, you are so great, and I am so small,

I tremble to think of you, World, at all;

And yet, when I said my prayers today,

A whisper inside me seemed to say,

'You are more than the Earth, though you are such a dot,

You can love and think, and the Earth cannot!"

The wonderful air is over me,

And the wonderful wind is shaking the tree,

It walks on the water, and whirls the mills,

And talks to itself on the tops of the hills.

You friendly Earth! How far do you go,

With the wheat-fields that nod and the rivers that flow.

With cities and gardens, and cliffs, and isles,

And people upon you for thousands of miles?

Ah, you are so great, and I am so small,

I tremble to think of you, World, at all;

And yet, when I said my prayers today,

A whisper inside me seemed to say,

'You are more than the Earth, though you are such a dot,

You can love and think, and the Earth cannot!"

en.value: Having a sweet tooth means:
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow:

1. Chocoholics no longer need to feel guilty about their desire for chocolate. They are simply the victim of the genes, scientists have found. The so called "sweet-tooth gene" has been identified by separate teams of researchers and helps explain why some find it harder to resist chocolate bars and cream cakes. It also raises the possibility of designing a drug which could "switch off" the gene and help people resist sugary foods. Children, in particular, risk their health by eating too many sweets and chocolates.

2. To identify the gene, research teams conducted almost identical experiments using mice which have differences in their ability to taste sweet foods. One of the team members said "A sweet taste receptor recognises the sweet content of food and initiates a cascade of events which signals to the brain that a sweet food has been eaten." He further added, "The same gene exists in humans, so it means that if your parents have a sweet tooth-then you probably will as well".

3. He said, "We have always known that some people have a sweeter tooth than others. But it has also been proved that if you are gradually exposed to less sugar, then the body becomes accustomed to less. They will be satisfied with a lower level of sweetness. Doctors warn against any form of gene therapy which seeks to deactivate the sweet gene. "We have produced this gene through evolution because sweet foods in nature are not poisonous, they give us energy. We all need to have some sugar in our diet," claim scientists. US researchers are using this discovery to develop artificial sweeteners without any after-taste.

options.value: teeth becoming decayed due to sugary food items&nbsp;
buying sweet food items from shops
being fond of sweets and chocolates

en.value: The phrase &#39;courtyards jostling together&#39; implies:
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow:

1. Every now and then we would speed through a village lined with waving Tibetan children. Their villages looked wonderful and so inviting that Dorje was not showing any signs of slowing down. Small clusters of single and double storey buildings with walk-in courtyards jostled together in the foothills to gain maximum exposure to the sun. The houses looked solid, built for the harsh environment. Walls are made up of stone to waist height and finished off with mud bricks to the roof. Tin cans lined the window ledges, with the bright orange of marigolds in full bloom livening up the black-and-white of the houses.

2. Branches of trees adorned with colourful prayer flags stood high into the wind from the top of the flat roofs. The auspicious blue, white, red, green and yellow colours of the fabrics stood out against the rich blue of the Tibetan sky. Each prayer flag carries a picture of Lungta, the jewelled dragon horse, who carries the owner's prayers up to the divine every time the flag flaps in the wind.

3. The larger villages have healthy trees, usually willows or poplars which look quite out of place in the generally treeless landscape. Wood is a precious commodity in the highland areas of Tibet and is never wasted. The few shrubs which grow wild on the hillsides are harvested for use as brushwood and each courtyard wall is piled high with sticks gathered from the mountains to get a fire started. The lack of solid fuel in the shape of wood is not a problem for the Tibetans, who have an ingenious wood substitute: yak dung.

options.value: being one on top of the other
being in different sizes and dimensions
